sources.title: Close-Up
sources.description: “Good little thriller, well worth a watch” “Great atmosphere, some suspenseful moments” (IMDB reviews quotes). A low-budget crime drama with unnecessary comic relief. Alan Baxter and Virginia Gilmore head an adequate supporting cast. In fact adequate describes every aspect of this film noir wannabe that was shot entirely in Manhattan. IMDB rating 6.4. Directed by Jack Donohue. Released in 1948. Two minutes are missing.

metadata.Plot: Pretending to be Mohsen Makhmalbaf making his next movie, Hossain Sabzian enters the home of a well-to-do family in Tehran, promising it a prominent part in his next movie. The actual people involved in the incident re-enact the actual events, followed by the footage from the actual trial that took place.
metadata.Actors: Hossain Sabzian, Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Abolfazl Ahankhah
